TopicTitle: Hi to KSP friends & question about quick replies

Articles.Content:
Hi to all of you who I know and to all who I don't ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif). Just have joined the forum, mainly I was forced to do so, because I had to report a bug ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif).

But, being thoroughly optimistic, enjoying being part of the community ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif).

I have a quick question about Quick Reply function here in the forum. Every time I post a quick reply it says that it has to be approved by moderator of the forum, and only then it will appear. But "regular" replies to the thread appear immediately.

Is it because I have a low post count, or I have joined just yesterday?

Couldn't find anything about it in the FAQ. Thanks to anyone who answers ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Salud KSP!

Hi HighSpeedSteel, and welcome to the forums!

Once you have three posts, you will not need moderator approval and you can then set up an avatar, if you like.

This is a very helpful community and I'm sure your optimism will be justified.

Happy landings!

Welcome aboard!

Yup, it is because of a low post count. The KSP forum is, I think, one of the most carefully groomed forums out there. We have a fantastic moderation staff, and the purpose of it is mostly to make sure that you're not an evil robot.

Well, some of us evil robots (so called) have succeeded in getting past it ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif).

Welcome, Highspeedsteel!

Hello! Yep three post rule, everyone gets through that pretty quickly usually. The Moderators are quite on the ball and really help keep this place positive and productive so that we can learn and share fun experiences together.

(Thanks mods!)
Well, I can't say anything about the three post rule which hasn't already been said, so welcome!
